alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Lexington; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 24 at 5:20PM EDT until July 24 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN CALHOUN...SOUTHEASTERN LEXINGTON AND SOUTHEASTERN RICHLAND COUNTIES... At 518 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Sandy Run, or 12 miles southwest of McEntire Air Base, and is nearly stationary. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...SC Highway Patrol reported tree damage 7 miles west of Saint Matthews. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. Locations impacted include... St. Matthews, Congaree National Park, Gadsden, Sandy Run and Fort Motte. This includes Interstate 26 between mile markers 123 and 140. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection seek shelter inside a sturdy building and stay away from windows. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways or walk through high water.
